text: Mose John Allison, Jr. (November 11, 1927 - November 15, 2016) was an American jazz blues pianist, singer and songwriter. It was not until 1963 that his record label allowed him to release an album entirely of vocals. He was known for his songs "Parchman Songs" and "Young Man Blues". Allison died on November 15, 2016 at his home in Hilton Head, South Carolina from natural causes, ages 89. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official Site *Concert review at allaboutjazz.com (February 11, 2005) *Los Angeles Citybeat, Mose Allison Interview *Official IBis Recordings website for "Mose Allison American Legend Live in California" Category:1927 births Category:2016 deaths Category:American jazz musicians Category:American blues musicians Category:American pianists Category:American songwriters Category:American trumpeters Category:Singers from Mississippi Category:Musicians from Mississippi Category:Writers from Mississippi
title: Mose Allison
